epic.title: Core CMS Functionality
epic.description: Development of foundational capabilities for the Content Management System, enabling authenticated content creation, editing, and deletion.

stories.title: Basic Content Creation and Editing
stories.description: Enable authenticated users to create, edit, and delete content pages in the CMS, ensuring real-time updates in the interface. Authentication to be managed through Auth0.
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user attempting to access the content creation page, when they are not logged in, then they should be redirected to Auth0 for authentication.
Given a logged-in user via Auth0, when they create a content page with a title and body text, then the new page is saved and displayed immediately in the CMS.
Given an existing content page, when a logged-in user edits and saves changes, then the updates are reflected immediately in the CMS interface.
Given an existing content page, when a logged-in user deletes it, then it is removed from the CMS and no longer accessible.
Content save operations should complete within 2 seconds under normal load.
The system should support a minimum of 50 concurrent editing sessions without degradation.
Auth0 login and authentication process should complete within 3 seconds under normal load.

tasks.title: Auth0 Authentication Integration
tasks.description: Integrate Auth0 for user login and authentication, ensuring sessions are managed before granting access to content management features.

tasks.title: Content Creation UI
tasks.description: Develop UI components that allow users to enter content titles and body text, with form validation and submission handling.

tasks.title: Content Editing Functionality
tasks.description: Implement the ability to edit existing content pages, including retrieval and updating of stored page data.

tasks.title: Content Deletion Capability
tasks.description: Add an option to delete content pages with confirmation prompts and backend data removal.

tasks.title: Real-time CMS Update
tasks.description: Ensure changes to content are reflected immediately in the CMS interface without requiring a manual refresh.

tasks.title: Performance Optimization
tasks.description: Optimize backend and frontend code to meet performance targets for save and authentication operations.

notes: Requirement specifies Auth0 as the authentication provider. It is assumed that Auth0 integration will manage user login and session handling before enabling content CRUD operations. Non-functional requirements around performance and concurrent usage are included in acceptance criteria.
